body_html:
It's my understanding that the choice is task dependent. I would suggest that people who want MFCCs use tf.contrib.signal.mfccs_from_log_mel_spectrograms, which gives you the choice of whether to use amplitude or power (or power in decibels, as librosa does).

This also gets you GPU and TPU support, which this C++ op doesn't :).
body_text:
It's my understanding that the choice is task dependent. I would suggest that people who want MFCCs use tf.contrib.signal.mfccs_from_log_mel_spectrograms, which gives you the choice of whether to use amplitude or power (or power in decibels, as librosa does).
This also gets you GPU and TPU support, which this C++ op doesn't :).
body:
It's my understanding that the choice is task dependent. I would suggest that people who want MFCCs use [`tf.contrib.signal.mfccs_from_log_mel_spectrograms`](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/contrib/signal/mfccs_from_log_mel_spectrograms), which gives you the choice of whether to use amplitude or power (or power in decibels, as librosa does). 

This also gets you GPU and TPU support, which this C++ op doesn't :).
